title: Amid Attacks and Thefts, Some Retail Workers Want to Fight Back
abstract: Assaults at stores have been increasing at a faster pace than the national average. Some workers are tired of fearing for their safety.
org_facet: United Food and Commercial Workers Union

title: Less Takeout, More Produce Swapping: How Inflation Is Altering People’s Behavior
abstract: From driving fewer miles to downgrading vacations, Americans are making meaningful changes to their spending. Here’s how five households are coping with the highest inflation in decades.

multimedia.caption: Amber Dowdy with her husband, Mike. Before price increases began to eat into their budget, the couple didn’t think too hard about their spending.

title: The G7 ponders capping oil prices to deny Russia revenues. How would it work?
abstract: The goal is a way to tighten Russia’s finances while preventing big rises in oil prices. But it’s unclear if such a plan could succeed.

title: ‘An Invisible Cage’: How China Is Policing the Future
abstract: Vast surveillance data allows the state to target people whose behavior or characteristics are deemed suspicious by an algorithm, even if they’ve done nothing wrong.
byline: By Paul Mozur, Muyi Xiao and John Liu
des_facet: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
org_facet: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China

abstract: The market for weapon detectors and crisis alert badges in schools is booming. But there are questions about whether the new technology is effective.

abstract: The gap with workers widened even further as public companies granted top executives rich pay packages partly inspired by Tesla.

abstract: From changing their work hours to driving farther in search of cheaper deals, people have been making crafty calculations to grapple with expensive gasoline.

abstract: Companies like BlueWave are betting on it. But the technology has its critics.

title: The Flight of New York City’s Wealthy Was a Once-in-a-Century Shock

title: Michel David-Weill, Influential Lazard Banker, Dies at 89
abstract: A member of his firm’s family dynasty, he built Lazard into an elite player on Wall Street while keeping it a smaller operation than most of its competitors.
